comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: Quote from: JamesDaniel90 on January 23, 2023, 11:45:37 AMI have realized that this problem only occurs on those cryptos in my portfolio that I have both bought & sold, it doesn't make note of the sell amount therefore my overall cost is not reduced it stays the same. Oh I get what you mean. So this is not exactly a problem, just a way of how Coingecko record your trades. The amount of sell transaction will not reduce your cost, instead it will be recorded in "Proceeds". The overall PnL then will be evaluated by:Code:PnL = Holdings + Proceeds - CostIn my example:I bought 100 $DYDX at $1.84. Total cost = $184.I sell 50 $DYDX at $2. Proceeds = $100I'm still holding 50 DYDX, with current price at ~$1.83. Total holdings = $91.42My PnL would be = $91.42 + $100 - $184 = $7.42

comments.author: Erumo
comments.body: all the trackers are the same. But it is preferable to use the app that is updated frequently, allows to make backups or import/export data, would be great if has a desktop version and synchronization, and if it has a free version, than it should be ads free. I have an experience of using Delta and Blockfolio apps. I have used Delta, because after an update Blockfolio crashed and I could not get info from it (all I could do is to install it on different device). I dont like Delta, because it sometimes shows me "oooops, smth went wrong" and did not update prices, so you have to restart app several times. When "time is money", that aint good. I liked that Blockfolio supported more altcoins and you can trade directly from that app. I would use Blockfolio if I am more a trader guy, and I would use Delta if I just want to monitor my assets.
